{"script": "Alright, let's dive into what's happening around the world today. Honestly, we've got some wild stories coming at you, so get ready!

First up, we've got the tea on why Trump attacked a judge and his family during a speech at Mar-a-Lago. Apparently, according to CNN's Maggie Haberman, the reasoning behind his outburst was...well, let's just say it's classic Trump. Gotta keep us on our toes, am I right?

Moving on to the international scene, we've got a real tragedy unfolding in Kenya. Thousands of people gathered in Nairobi to pay respects to veteran opposition leader Raila Odinga, but things took a dark turn when security forces opened fire on the crowds, leaving four people dead. Lowkey, that's just messed up.

Now, let's talk tech and business. Get this - the expected reduction in funding for anti-malaria efforts could lead to the "deadliest resurgence ever," according to a new study. Ngl, that's some scary stuff. But hey, at least there's a plot twist - the NSO group has been permanently barred from targeting WhatsApp users with their Pegasus spyware. Looks like Meta's putting their foot down.
